# Uniswap Universal Router Calldata Parser

A web-based parser for Uniswap Universal Router transaction calldata, supporting V2, V3, and V4 swaps.

## ðŸš€ Live Demo

**[Try it now!](https://babgev.github.io/CallDataParser/)**

## Features

- âœ… Parse Universal Router calldata for V2, V3, and V4 transactions
- âœ… Decode all command types and parameters
- âœ… Format addresses and amounts (Wei to decimal)
- âœ… Modern UI with dark mode support
- âœ… Copy parsed JSON to clipboard
- âœ… Built with official Uniswap SDKs

## Tech Stack

- **Frontend**: React 19 + TypeScript
- **Build Tool**: Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS v4
- **Blockchain Utils**: viem
- **Parser**: @uniswap/universal-router-sdk

## Installation

```bash
npm install
```

## Development

```bash
npm run dev
```

Open [http://localhost:5173](http://localhost:5173) in your browser.

## Build

```bash
npm run build
```

## Usage

1. Paste Universal Router transaction calldata (starting with `0x`) into the input field
2. Click "Parse Calldata"
3. View decoded commands and parameters
4. Click on any command card to expand and see details
5. Copy the parsed JSON using the "Copy JSON" button

## Project Structure

```
src/
â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ CalldataInput.tsx      # Input component for calldata
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ParsedOutput.tsx       # Display parsed results
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ CommandCard.tsx        # Individual command card
â”œâ”€â”€ utils/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ parser.ts              # Wrapper around Uniswap SDK parser
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ formatter.ts           # Format addresses/amounts using viem
â”œâ”€â”€ types/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.ts               # TypeScript type definitions
â”œâ”€â”€ App.tsx                    # Main app component
â””â”€â”€ main.tsx                   # Entry point
```

## How It Works

1. **Parser**: Uses `@uniswap/universal-router-sdk`'s `CommandParser.parseCalldata()` to decode transaction calldata
2. **Formatter**: Uses `viem` utilities to format addresses and Wei amounts
3. **UI**: Modern React components with Tailwind CSS for a clean, responsive interface

## Deployment

This app is automatically deployed to GitHub Pages using GitHub Actions.

### Automatic Deployment

Pushes to the `main` or `master` branch automatically trigger a deployment via GitHub Actions.

### GitHub Pages Setup

1. Go to your repository Settings â†’ Pages
2. Set Source to "Deploy from a branch"
3. Select branch: `gh-pages` and folder: `/ (root)`
4. Save - the workflow will automatically build and deploy on push

The app will be available at: `https://[username].github.io/CallDataParser/`
